com.github.westonpace.jayvee.workflow

Class WorkflowSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.westonpace.jayvee.workflow.WorkflowSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StandardWorkerRunnable.WorkerRunnableEndListener

    public class WorkflowSystem
extends Object
implements StandardWorkerRunnable.WorkerRunnableEndListener

    Controller for a collection of workers. This class represents a set of workers whose sources and sinks are connected by buffers. This is the main driver for the JayVee workflow architecture. This should be created by a SystemBuilder and once created, can be started, stopped, and joined.

    When it is running it makes each of the workers iterate as fast as possible (unless that worker has been marked OnRequestOnly). Once a worker has ended its output buffer then any workers who read from that output buffer will soon run out of input and end their output buffers. Once all terminating buffers have ended then the system will stop naturally.

    If the system is forcefully stopped by a call to interrupt then it will trigger an InterruptedException on all of the workers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void interrupt()
      Interrupts all of the workers in the system.
      void join()
      Waits for the workers in the system to finish.
      void start()
      Starts the system.
      void workerEnded(com.github.westonpace.jayvee.workflow.WorkerRunnable worker) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the system. Once started all buffers will begin iterating and taking data from their sources to push into their sinks.

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt()
        Interrupts all of the workers in the system.

      • join

        public void join()
        Waits for the workers in the system to finish. The system is finished when all workers have one or more sources which have ended. Workers with only sinks don't count towards this check.
        Throws:
        RuntimeInterruptedException - If this thread is interrupted while waiting

      • workerEnded

        public void workerEnded(com.github.westonpace.jayvee.workflow.WorkerRunnable worker)
        Specified by:
        workerEnded in interface StandardWorkerRunnable.WorkerRunnableEndListener
